value: Northern Brändö archipelago. The Åva ring structure, clearly visible on maps, was caused by a magma chamber that did not become a volcano.

and the main island of the municipality.

Brändö consists of the villages Lappo, Asterholma, Torsholma, Baggholma, Brändö by, Björnholma, Korsö, Fiskö, Åva and Jurmo.

Lappo, Asterholma and Jurmo are separate islands, without direct road connection.
Brändö is an island group in north-east Åland, by the border to
. Most of the major islands are connected with a road with good view out over the surrounding archipelago.
Brändö is Swedish speaking, like the rest of Åland. Knowledge of English should be good as in the rest of Finland. Knowledge of Finnish is not too good.
You can reach Brändö by ferry operated by
on the Finnish mainland to the village of Åva ("Norra Linjen",  M/S
), near the main island of Åland to Lappo and to Torsholma.
To reach the separate islands there are smaller ferries,
from Åva-Jurmo vv., and Torsholma-Lappo-Asterholma vv. Note that some arrivals need to be booked in advance.

value: hours=weekdays mid June to mid August
content=A wooden cross church built in the 1890s.
content=Old boats and fishing and hunting tools. There's also an blacksmith's workshop.

content=See the highland cattle, take a stroll in the woods at a walking path, climb the watch tower to see the islands surrounding Jurmo. Visit their small museum with fishing tools in an old fishing hut. Eat at their restaurant and café open in the summer months and sleep at their hostel. From the small grocery shop open in summer time you can buy food to prepare in the hostel. There's also possible to go on boat excursions to see e.g. seals, an old fishing camp, and rent kayaks and bikes.
